intro: Aporum hypopogon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved aporum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
